title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Fossil teeth reveal a previously unknown human ancestor from eastern Africa
items.description: Scientists say the teeth belonged to a type of Australopithecus, a relative of Lucy’s species, that coexisted with our genus, Homo

items.title: Judge tells NSF to reinstate suspended UCLA grants
items.description: Ruling comes as government seeks settlement with UCLA on larger set of suspended grants

items.title: Featherweight flyers could ‘levitate’ above Earth indefinitely
items.description: Making use of an obscure physics effect to fly, devices could probe the upper atmosphere and explore Mars

items.title: ‘Sex reversal’ is surprisingly common in birds, new study suggests
items.description: Survey of five Australian avians finds numerous discordant individuals, including a genetically male bird that had laid an egg

items.title: Youths buried in Anglo-Saxon cemeteries carried West African DNA
items.description: Despite bearing remarkably far-flung genetic origins, a girl and young man were buried just like their peers

items.title: Europe mulls boosting military R&D with civilian science funding
items.description: Worried about regional security, bloc pushes forward on controversial “dual-use” approach

items.title: ‘Superefficient’ weaver ants show remarkable strength in numbers
items.description: Unlike people, these nest-building insects pull harder in teams

items.title: Death threats to NIH official spark debate over aggressive campaign to end animal research
items.description: White Coat Waste Project files complaint over government employee’s emails claiming it incited harassment against Nicole Kleinstreuer

items.title: New method reveals perhaps the most massive black hole yet spotted
items.description: Big brute 5 billion light-years from Earth is 36 billion times as massive as the Sun

items.title: NIH ponders overhauling HIV budget to capitalize on prevention breakthrough
items.description: Scientists warn $1 billion push for “implementation science” spurred by promise of lenacapavir will hurt research on new treatments and vaccines
